news.title: Digital geofencing for Sultanpur park buffer zone soon to monitor land-use change, curb violations
news.para: Sultanpur National Park's eco-sensitive zone is undergoing digital geofencing with five concentric rings to monitor land-use changes in real time.  Strict regulations are being implemented, including bans on mobile towers within 3km and construction within 300 meters, to protect the park's vital habitat for migratory birds.

news.title: Rajasthan government forms ministerial committee for land allotment policy-2025
news.para: Rajasthan government has established a six-member cabinet sub-committee to ensure the effective implementation of the Rajasthan Land Allotment Policy-2025. This committee, comprising key ministers, will review proposals for exemptions and relaxations, forwarding them with recommendations to the Chief Minister for final decisions.

news.title: About 50% of GIFT City built-up area allotted: CEO
news.para: GIFT City has seen significant development, allotting development rights for approximately 50% of its total planned built-up area. The last quarter alone saw over 100 entities decide to establish a presence, marking a record high. The city is emerging as a hub for finance, technology, and various leasing activities, with banking assets surpassing $100 billion.

news.title: How FAR will Chandigarh administration go to make housing affordable?
news.para: Chandigarh's urban planning department has recommended increasing the Floor Area Ratio (FAR) for the Sector 53 housing scheme from 1.5 to 2. This move aims to boost usable flat area and potentially lower prices, addressing concerns over affordability and delays. The decision follows a meeting where the administrator directed revisions to make the project more accessible to thousands of applicants.

news.title: Sand shortage in Davanagere hits construction amid auction delays
news.para: Construction in Davanagere faces delays due to stalled sand block auctions and hurdles in issuing occupancy certificates. While exemptions offer some relief, smooth sand availability is expected by February, following the auction's completion. The new state sand policy, though causing initial delays, aims to streamline the process.

news.title: Karnataka HC issues guidelines to auto-update civil court decrees in digital land records
news.para: The Karnataka High Court has mandated the integration of civil court decrees into the state's digital revenue systems. A new workflow in Kaveri 2.0 will streamline decree-based mutations, ensuring judicial declarations are promptly reflected in land records. This initiative aims to enhance transparency and reduce litigation by preventing misuse of decrees.

news.title: NGT summons government officials, developer over waste spill
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has summoned top officials from Gmada, a gram panchayat, and a private developer for failing to address untreated wastewater discharge. For over a year, sewage has been stagnating in an open plot near Daun Majra village, impacting residents. The tribunal noted systemic negligence and ordered personal appearances of officials on December 8.

news.title: Why Aravali watchers look at SC’s 100 metres mining definition with concern
news.para: A Supreme Court ruling on Aravali hills' height is causing worry. Environmentalists fear this definition could be used to allow more construction. This might impact conservation plans for natural areas. Many hills could be excluded from protection. Experts warn this could harm the environment and air quality.

news.title: Lucknow development body to launch IT City housing project in January 2026
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority is launching its ambitious IT City project in January, offering land donors priority plot selection via lottery. This massive 2,660-acre development, incorporating housing projects and a golf city, will provide 25% developed land back to donors. Following the lottery, remaining plots will be open for public registration, promising a new township for nearly a lakh residents.

news.title: Noida: YEIDA sends notices to 366 allottees over registry delay
news.para: Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) has issued a 10-day ultimatum to 366 plot allottees to execute lease deeds or face cancellation. This move aims to expedite industrial development, but allottees are seeking a pause on cancellations for pending 'zero-period' exemption applications, citing Authority-level delays.

news.title: Chandigarh housing board's IT Park plotted development project move stalled
news.para: Chandigarh's urban planning department has denied the Chandigarh Housing Board's request for individual plotted housing in the Rajiv Gandhi Chandigarh Technology Park. The decision aligns with the Chandigarh Master Plan 2031, which prohibits such development and favors high-density group housing.

news.title: UAE based DAMAC Group opens new GCC in Noida, plans second in Pune
news.para: DAMAC Group from the UAE has unveiled DAMAC Shared Services India, establishing a Global Capability Center in Noida with a team of over 250 professionals. Looking ahead, the company aims to launch another facility in Pune by 2026, intending to employ an additional 100 skilled individuals.

news.title: Shaping construction careers: How Novatr is transforming AEC learning
news.para: Novatr presents an innovative array of tech-focused courses designed specifically for professionals in Architecture, Engineering, and Construction. These programs not only address the skills gap but also offer hands-on, relevant training that aligns with industry needs.

news.title: Central Park invests ₹2,000 crore to develop residential project along Dwarka Expressway
news.para: Central Park plans an investment of ₹2,000 crore for its new residential project, Delphine. Located in Gurugram's sector 104 along the Dwarka Expressway, this development will feature six high-rise towers. Construction is slated to begin in 2026, with completion expected by 2032.

news.title: Jamshedpur, Dhanbad officials take action against illegal constructions
news.para: Authorities in Jamshedpur and Dhanbad are cracking down on illegal constructions.  Owners deviating from approved building plans face demolition and hefty fines.  An enforcement squad will conduct random inspections, and residents are urged to report violations. This multi-pronged strategy aims to create a more organized, clean, and safe urban environment for all.

news.title: Pune civic body to face revenue loss as state stops tax recovery in merged areas again
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation anticipates another year of revenue shortfall. The state government's directive to halt property tax collection in newly merged areas continues. This follows a Rs 80 crore loss last fiscal. Residents of these areas had objected to high civic taxes. The state government needs to amend laws for tax recovery.

news.title: Embassy Developments to launch six residential projects in North Bengaluru
news.para: Embassy Developments is gearing up to unveil six exciting residential ventures in North Bengaluru, projected to be valued at ₹10,300 crore when they launch in FY26. They aim to hit a pre-sales target of ₹5,000 crore within the same fiscal year.

news.title: Delhi HC sets up panel to speed up industrial area redevelopment, curb Yamuna pollution
news.para: The Delhi High Court has formed a three-member committee to expedite industrial area redevelopment and improve wastewater treatment for the Yamuna River. This action follows the court's strong criticism of agency inaction and delays in managing industrial effluents. The committee will include representatives from DSIIDC, DPCC, and DJB, aiming to address infrastructure development and monitoring responsibilities.

news.title: Rakesh Roshan, wife buy five commercial units worth ₹19.68 crore in Mumbai
news.para: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan and his wife Pramila have acquired five commercial units in Mumbai's Vaidya West World One Aeropolis. The total transaction amounted to ₹19.68 crore. These deals were registered in November 2025.

news.title: County Group acquires five-acres land in sector 151 Noida for ₹473 crore
news.para: County Group has secured a five-acre plot in Noida's Sector 151 for approximately ₹473 crore. The land was purchased through a state government auction. The company intends to build a premium, low-density residential development. This project will feature 226 homes spread across three apartment configurations. The total built-up area will span 11 lakh square feet.
